greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A255127(A252460(n)).
comment: a(n) tells which number in Ludic array A255127 is at the same position where n is in array A083221, the sieve of Eratosthenes. As both arrays have A005843 (even numbers) and A016945 as their two topmost rows, both sequences are among the fixed points of this permutation.
Equally: a(n) tells which number in array A255129 is at the same position where n is in the array A083140, as they are the transposes of above two arrays.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(A008578(n)) = A003309(n). [Maps noncomposites to Ludic numbers.]
a(A001248(n)) = A254100(n). [Maps squares of primes to "postludic numbers".]
(And similarly between other columns and rows of A083221 and A255127.)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 22 2015
